questions.text:
1.  A parallel program consists of three tasks: Task 1, Task 2, and Task 3.  Their execution times on a single core are as follows:

| Task | Execution Time (seconds) |
|---|---|
| Task 1 | 5 |
| Task 2 | 10 |
| Task 3 | 15 |

Tasks 1 and 2 can be executed concurrently, but Task 3 depends on both Task 1 and Task 2 completing.  You have access to a multi-core processor with four identical cores.  

a)  Draw a task dependency graph illustrating the relationships between the three tasks.
b)  Determine the minimum execution time if all three tasks are run on this four-core processor. Show your reasoning, including task assignment to cores and the total execution time calculation.  


2.  You are given a simple multicore system with two types of cores:  Type A and Type B. Each core can execute one task at a time.  You have two tasks, Task X and Task Y, with the following execution times:

| Task | Type A Execution Time (ms) | Type B Execution Time (ms) |
|---|---|---|
| Task X | 20 | 30 |
| Task Y | 10 | 15 |

There are two Type A cores and one Type B core available.

a) What is the minimum execution time to complete both tasks using this system?  Show your work, including the task assignments to cores.
b)  Assume that Task X and Task Y are independent (no dependencies). What is the speedup achieved compared to a single Type A core?  Show your calculation.
